Body: Why is it important, from the security point of view, to use a protocol created for conecting devices(eg. ZigBee) in the Internet of Things, and not a protocol initially created for transmitting messages (eg. Wi-fi)?

Aside from the question being very broad and very probably also primarily opinion based, I think you're just wrong in assuming that security is even a significant decision factor between eg zigbee and wifi. These two technologies are entirely different beasts.
Security isn't the reason you'd want to choose Zigbee over WiFi. Most commonly, the consideration would be that you're working with low-power devices.

It's not. The reason to use ZigBee is mostly that it's low range, low power, low speed, and simple/cheap design. It's also using symmetric keys, so it's up to you to figure out how to distribute them.

There isn't really much reason to choose ZigBee if you're looking specifically for secure communication.
